page.title: 03ENERGY
page.content: {COAL MINING IN THE VALE OF NEATH.} COAL HAS BEEN MINED IN OUR AREA FOR THE PAST 300 YEARS BUT THE PRESENT MINE OF ABERPERGWM DATES BACK TO 1863. THE COLLIERY PRODUCES SOME OF THE BEST ANTHRACITE COAL IN THE COUNTRY<1800 SALEABLE TONNES PER WEEK> TO BE USED MAINLY AS DOMESTIC AND LARGE INSTITUTION (E.G.HOSPITALS) FUEL. THE MINE WHICH COVERS 600 HECTARES, EMPLOYS 434 MEN,310 OF WHOM WORK UNDERGROUND. THE MAIN DANGERS AT ABERPERGWM ARE ROOF FALLS AND POOR VENTILATION BUT WITH MODERN MACHINES AND SUPPRESSORS THE DUST IS KEPT TO A MINIMUM.THEY STILL HAVE TWO CANARIES AT THE COLLIERY TO TEST FOR THE PRESENCE OF METHANE GAS.HORSES ARE NO LONGER USED UNDERGROUND. {OPENCAST MINING OCCURS ON SOME OF THE {SURROUNDING HILLS OF OUR AREA.COAL CAN {BE MINED QUICKER AND CHEAPER HERE.
